Judul: MATHEMATICAL MODEL OF ORGANICALLY CROSS-LINKED POLYMER GELATION TIME TO EOR APPLICATION
Abstrak:
Increasing of demand in oil products definitely causes an improvement in oil depletion method
includes the using of chemical EOR (Enhance Oil Recovery) for instance polymer injection to
water shut-off treatment. A recent EOR technology has reported that the utilization of
organically cross-linked polymer can be synthesized and revealing more stable and stronger
bonding rather than commercially well-known heavy metal cross linking agent like Cr(III).
Heavy metal bonds the polymer structure with a coordinative-covalent bond which is not
strongly linked. Less strong bond reflects a possibility of released polymer bonding which leads
to an environmentally harmful state since it is composed by a heavy metal. Considering the
used concentration of each reactant, it reveals by adding only 0.2% to 3.0% of weight can obtain
a reasonable gelation time. By using previous experimental data from Sengupta et al. (2011), a
handy-mathematical model is then analytically developed and proposed to study the
phenomenon of gelation time to polymer system consisted of polyacrylamide, hexamethylene
tetramine and hydroquinone at pH = 8.0. Basic theory is developed based on reaction rate
equation and Arrhenius’ Law. Through a multivariable regression method which is done with
help of computer, a proposed model deals with a good agreement in its R-square value (?
0.93361) and by comparing the theoretical and experimental gelation time. This equation can
then be beneficial to adjust a desired polymer system behavior and be a profile modification
job in the oil field according to enhanced oil recovery application. It also predicts the duration
of polymer solution should be being injected to the reservoir, when a well can be produced after
treatment and how much substance to be spent. Thus, modification and prediction through this
formula can finally contribute to optimize such as price and time of a green water shut-off
treatment.
Kata Kunci: Mathematical model, Gelation time, Organic polymer, Chemical EOR, WSO
